title: ‘Man kept as caged slave stole ambulance to escape his brutal captor’
text:
Christopher Edwards, 38, was arrested and charged with kidnapping and assaulting a man escaped in a stolen ambulance (Picture: WCIO/WHIO)

A man who was kept as a caged slave stole an ambulance to escape a home where he had been tortured for days, police said.

Police in Clearcreek Township, Ohio responded to a fire house on Saturday to investigate an ambulance that had been taken while firefighters were away at a vehicle fire.

A firehouse window had been smashed by the ambulance thief, who authorities found a short time later at Dayton Children’s Hospital, where they also located the ambulance.

However, after interviewing the suspect, 22-year-old Patrick Coleman, police learned that he was an alleged kidnapping victim who stole the emergency vehicle in a desperate attempt to escape his captors.

Coleman said that he had been held hostage at a home across the street from the fire station – where he had been kept in a cage and brutally tortured.

Clearcreek Police Sergeant Wallace Stacy told WLWT: ‘ (Coleman) said that he had been held against his will at a home here in Clearcreek for several days, that he was tortured while he was there and that when he was able to get away, he ran to the firehouse and took the medic to aid in his escape.’

Authorities got a warrant to search the home. After interviewing other witnesses and suspects, police arrested Christopher Edwards, 38, and charged him with kidnapping and felonious assault.

According to court documents, investigators learned Coleman had been ‘restrained and harbored in a dog cage.’ Police added that they are still looking for other suspects they believe were involved.

A unnamed relative of Coleman’s said they do not know how Coleman ended up trapped in the home and are worried about their safety with other suspects still on the run. One of his family members said she had, ‘never seen anything so bad.’

Edwards was arraigned on in court on Monday, where the judge reportedly asked how he was doing and Edwards replied, ‘Horrible.’

Christopher Edwards was asked how he was doing in court and answered, ‘Horrible.’ (Picture: WLWT)

Police said they do not yet have a motive and are unsure how Coleman escaped.

Edwards is being held on a $350,000 bond. He was given a high bond because the judge noted he had drug-related warrants for his arrest and has failed to show up to court before.

He is due back in court on October 29.
description: Patrick Coleman, 22, reportedly stole an ambulance to escape a home where he had been kept captive in Clearcreek Township, Ohio.
